s1.ptxt: Remove brake drum referring to Rear Brake Drum Removal and Installation .
Remove brake shoe referring to Rear Brake Shoe Removal and Installation .
Loosen brake pipe flare nut (1) but only within the extent that fluid does not leak.
Remove wheel cylinder mounting bolts (2). Disconnect brake pipe from wheel cylinder and put wheel cylinder bleeder plug cap (3) onto pipe to prevent fluid from spilling.
Fit wheel cylinder to brake back plate, take off bleeder plug cap from brake pipe and connect pipe to wheel cylinder just enough to prevent fluid from leaking.
Tighten wheel cylinder mounting bolts to brake back plate (1) to specified torque.
Tighten flare nut of brake pipe (2) to specified torque.
Install bleeder plug cap (3) taken off from pipe back to bleeder plug.
Install brake shoe referring to Rear Brake Shoe Removal and Installation .
Install brake drum referring to step 1) to 2) of Rear Brake Drum Removal and Installation .
Fill reservoir with brake fluid and bleed brake system. For bleeding operation refer to Air Bleeding of Brake System .
Adjust, check brake and install rear wheel referring to step 3) to 6) of Rear Brake Drum Removal and Installation .
